definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to wash one's hands/to go to the toilet

sentences.english: Made of specially-treated material, the coat is light in weight and machine washable.
sentences.chinese: 该大衣由经过特殊处理的面料做成，重量轻，可机洗。

sentences.english: Wash grapes overnight after don't hire small fly.
sentences.chinese: 洗葡萄隔夜后不招小飞虫。

sentences.english: My laundry is not ready yet.
sentences.chinese: 我送洗的衣物尚未洗好。

sentences.english: It is the custom here to take a cold shower every evening in summer.
sentences.chinese: 在夏天每天傍晚洗冷水浴是这里的习俗。

sentences.english: But would you like express service or same-day?
sentences.chinese: 不外，您是要快洗效力照旧当日取？

sentences.english: “You don’t have to drop them off, ” Madeleine said, undeterred.
sentences.chinese: “你不用交给别人去洗，”玛德琳毫不退缩地说。

sentences.english: The dishwasher sponged off the dishes.
sentences.chinese: 洗碗机把那些盘子洗了。

sentences.english: The colors arent fast, so be careful when you wash this shirt.
sentences.chinese: 这些颜色易褪色，所以洗衬衫时要小心。

sentences.english: Sophie:Now wash them, then dice the potatoes and bell peppers. Then slice the meat.
sentences.chinese: 现在把他们都洗干净，青椒和土豆切成丁儿，肉切片。

sentences.english: Wash repellent-treated skin with soap and water after coming indoors.
sentences.chinese: 驱蚊洗治疗皮肤用肥皂和水以后，在室内。

sentences.english: The old woman a maid servant to clean her house.
sentences.chinese: 老妇人雇佣了一个暖和的仆人去洗她的马。

sentences.english: They were also very dirty and their hair smelled even after four washings, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 两人身上很脏，头发洗了四次仍散发着恶臭。

sentences.english: Doing dishes takes longer than using the dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 洗碟子比用洗碟机的时间要长。

sentences.english: Doing dishes takes longer than using the dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 洗碟子比用洗碟机的时间要长。

sentences.english: My younger sister and I alternated in doing the dishes.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹和我轮流洗盘碟。

sentences.english: This driver cleaned the truck with wdined onr this morning.
sentences.chinese: 上午这个司机用水把卡车洗了。

definition: to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
to wash one's hair/to have a shampoo
to wash one's hands/to go to the toilet
